choices.A: Configure the device to choose the best MED from the same AS.
choices.D: Implement deterministic MED to choose the best route from the different AS.
choices.C: Enable MED comparison between routes from neighbors in different AS.
choices.B: Set the device to ignore the conditional MED if the route originated in a different autonomous system.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I was confused as it appears to be typo on the IP address of the web server.

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/16046-bgp-med.html#examp1
For example, consider the following routes for network 10.0.0.0/8:
entry1: AS(PATH) 500, med 150, external, rid 172.16.13.1
entry2: AS(PATH) 100, med 200, external, rid 1.1.1.1
entry3: AS(PATH) 500, med 100, internal, rid 172.16.8.4
Example 2: bgp deterministic-med Disabled, bgp always-compare-med Enabled
Entry1 is compared to entry2. These entries are from different neighbor autonomous systems, but since the bgp always-compare-med command is enabled, MED is used in the comparison. Of these two entries, entry1 is better because it has a lower MED. Next, entry1 is compared to entry3. The MED is checked again because the entries are now from the same autonomous system. Entry3 is chosen as the best path.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/16046-bgp-med.html#examp1
For example, consider the following routes for network 10.0.0.0/8:
entry1: AS(PATH) 500, med 150, external, rid 172.16.13.1
entry2: AS(PATH) 100, med 200, external, rid 1.1.1.1
entry3: AS(PATH) 500, med 100, internal, rid 172.16.8.4
Example 2: bgp deterministic-med Disabled, bgp always-compare-med Enabled
Entry1 is compared to entry2. These entries are from different neighbor autonomous systems, but since the bgp always-compare-med command is enabled, MED is used in the comparison. Of these two entries, entry1 is better because it has a lower MED. Next, entry1 is compared to entry3. The MED is checked again because the entries are now from the same autonomous system. Entry3 is chosen as the best path.

Selected Answer: C
Enabling the bgp deterministic-med command ensures the comparison of the MED variable when choosing routes advertised by different peers in the same autonomous system. 

Enabling the bgp always-compare-med command ensures the comparison of the MED for paths from neighbors in different autonomous systems.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/16046-bgp-med.html

bgp deterministic-med command compares MED variable when choosing routes advertised by different peers inside the same autonomous system.
bgp always-compare-med command compares MED variable for paths from neighbors in different autonomous systems.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Answer is C. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/16046-bgp-med.html#examp1
I think Deterministic Med will select the last entry as the best as it is external. Always-compare-med should be used to select 1.1.1.1 ... Ans C seems to be correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must update the routing toward the web server with IP address 35.22.13.1. The primary path must be configured via the neighbor router with ID 1.1.1.1. However, local-preference configuration is not permitted on R1. Which task must the engineer perform on R1 to complete the implementation?

choices.B: Attach peer_acl_1 in for session protection duration 1 on RX.
choices.C: Add session protection duration 60 for peer_acl_1 under the MPLS LDP instance on RZ.
choices.D: Enable IGP-LDP sync on RZ and RX.
choices.A: Configure peer_acl_2 on RX and allow IP address 10.10.10.6 in LDP.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
C is wrong because acl1 does not include the right peer address

comments.content: Sorry, C is right (ACL1 is ok)

discussion.content:

C is Correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The radio network and packet core are using the route RX-RZ-RB to establish communication. The LDP session between 10.10.10.5 and 10.10.10.1 is experiencing link flapping at random intervals for 30-45 seconds each time. A network engineer must protect the LDP session and improve MPLS traffic convergence. Which action meets these requirements?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer working for a private telecommunication company with an employee ID 4402:98:032 upgrades the WAN link between routers ASBR-101 and ASBR-201 to 1Gb by installing a new physical connection between the Gi3 interfaces. Which BGP attribute must the engineer configure on ASBR-201 so that the existing WAN link on Gi2 is maintained as a backup?

discussion.content:
Answer should be A
MED (Metric) default is 0 so making metric 100 for the advertisement to bgp neighbor on the Gi2 link will make it the backup. 

The options for "set as-path prepend 65101 65101" are using the wrong ASN, should be prepending ASN 65201 which is it's own ASN so that rules those options out.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Correct ans is A,
As path prepend options are not right as it is prepending neighbor's as. Route will be blocked

choices.A:
router bgp 100
neighbor 10.0.0.1 remote-as 500
neighbor 10.0.0.1 route-map ciscotest in
choices.C:
router bgp 100
neighbor 10.0.0.1 remote-as 500
neighbor 10.0.0.1 route-map ciscotest
choices.D:
router bgp 100
neighbor 10.0.0.1 remote-as 500
neighbor 10.0.0.1 route-map ciscotest out
choices.B:
router bgp 100
neighbor 10.0.0.1 remote-as 500
neighbor 10.0.0.1 route-map ciscotest both

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is implementing the BGP attribute on the customer's network to select the preferred path. Only BGP’s well-known discretionary attribute must be used. FTP prefixes should not be selected as part of this implementation. Which configuration must the engineer implement to complete the task?

choices.C: Allow 172.16.20.1 in the BGP advertisement on R3 in the route-map
choices.B: Add the next-hop-self command on R6 to enable R3 iBGP peering
choices.D: Remove the route-map on R4 when advertising 172.16.20.1 in BGP to R3
choices.A: Advertise application server 172.16.20.1 in the OSPF routing table on R6

discussion.content: Answer C. R3 is a the aggregation node for the Access Site. It learns the prefix 172.16.20.1 via OSPF; it might redistribute it as BGP toward Access site routers. Its a common practice to filter out the prefixes you dont want. in that case C is a plausible answer.
